page.title: 06FARMING WINTERBOURNE VALLEY
page.content: {FARMS}Dairy or Mixed range from small- holdings ave. 200acres to a large Ltd. Company farm. Market garden at Rew has \ acre glass for tomatoes. Runnerbeans and onions grown outdoors.Produce sold to wholesaler.{PRACTICE} Grass, Kale, Turnips, Beet grazed in strips controlled by electric fencing. Land fertilized by artificials or slurry. Tractors use 6-furrow reversible ploughs, cultivators, and rollers to prepare soil for sowing seed. Corn sprayed 5 or 6 times with a weedkiller during growth and harvested by 5m-cut Combine.Overmoist corn taken to drier. Round/High-density square balers pick up straw also cut grass dried for hay. Baled green silage grass is sealed in black polythene. Rows of cut grass are picked up, chopped by Forage harvester mixed with molasses & compressed into clamps to make silage for winter feed.
